titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William P. Brownback and A. E. Stone, Judgment
CWG4179

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Grant Circuit Court
May Term -- 5th June 1863
The Commonwealth of Ky. Plaintiff. Prosecution for felony
Against
Thos. Renfro. Wm P. Brumback and A. E. Stone Defendants

Upon the calling of this cause at the present term the Defendants Thomas Renfro, Wm P. Brumback & A. E. Stone, were each called by the Sheriff, and said Thomas Renfro failed to appear but made default.

The Commonwealth thereupon called a witness who being sworn proved that when this prosecution was called at the last term of this court, the court ordered the Sheriff to call said Renfro, and that said Renfro was then called and failed to appear --

And it further appearing that the Recognizance in this case bearing date June 9th 1862 for $500 -- was forfeited by an order of said court at its last term and that a summons was issued against defendant Brumback & Stone to appear at this term of the court and show cause if any they had, why judgement should not be rendered against them for the amount of said forfeited recognizance, which summons was duly served on said defendants a sufficient time before the commencement of this court and said Defts. bring before the court by service & by counsel an failing to show any sufficient reason against the rendition of Judgment on said recognizance. it is now adjudged and ordered that the Commonwealth recover of the said Defendants, Thomas Renfro, Wm P. Brumback & A. E. Stone the sum of Five hundred Dollars, with the costs of this motion on the forfeited recognizance for which the Commonwealth may have execution.

A copy attest
N. H. Jeffers C.G.C.C.

The Commonwealth
vs
Renfro, Brumback & Stone
copy of Judgt.
